structure: This memory system contains three storage types: (1) Structure definition - dynamic metadata describing memory organization, updatable via tools; (2) Key-based storage - structured dictionary for named data items; (3) Raw text storage - unstructured text for notes and free-form content supporting both replacement and appending operations.
raw:
Haiku about recursion in programming:
Endless looping paths,
A function calls itself—deep,
Echoes in the code.
Haiku about recursion in programming:

Loop within itself,
Answers nested, deep, unseen—
Code returns again.
Haiku about recursion in programming:

Infinite mirror
Code calls upon itself, deep—
Loops within the mind.
